newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-SPANISH FIRST DIVISION WEEKEND MATCHES.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SPANISH FIRST DIVISION WEEKEND MATCHES.

text.p: Spanish first division matches over the weekend:
Atletico face an Espanyol side that tends to do well in the Calderon stadium without injured striker Leonardo Biagini, but with defender Toni Munoz back from suspension.
Deportivo are still unbeaten and do well away from home, but will be without both Mauro Silva and Martin Vazquez in their bid to avenge last year's 4-0 drubbing in the Galician derby.
Russian defender Andrei Moj is out for struggling Hercules, while goalkeeper Marcelino Ojeda is back for Tenerife. Tenerife start as strong favourites.
Valencia's Francisco Camarasa, Ivan Campos, Claudio Lopez and Fernando Gomez all injured, but even so Extremadura should present no problems.
Sporting hope to have new Russian signing Cheryshev fit to make his debut against a rapidly-improving Athletic where Inigo Larrainzar takes over from injured defender Aitor Larrazabal.
Celta welcome back international forwards Haim Revivo and Alexander Mostovoi for a game which will tell whether Logrones' draw at Real Madrid was a fluke or the beginning of a recovery.
Zaragoza fans are hoping Victor Esparrago's first game in charge will also produce the first home win of the season against a Betis side unbeaten in six away games.
After a run of bad luck and worse refereeing, Real will look to Romanian striker Gheorghe Craioveanu for leadership against a Rayo side that continues to surprise.
Oviedo are missing Peter Dubovsky, Jose Gay, Pablo Maqueda and Ivan Ania through injury for a trip to a club that have gone five home games without winning.
Brazilian striker Bebeto is set to make his first appearance since signing for Sevilla against a Real Madrid side that is struggling both to entertain and to win.
Surprise side Valladolid are cast as extras in the much-heralded reappearance of striker Ronaldo and swansong of veteran Barcelona captain Jose Maria Bakero.
